The claim was based on a specific memo f: which is a nonpartisan organization responsible for analyzing state budget matters.
The memo was titled: Value of (state and federal) public assistance and student financial aid benefits and tax credits available to two hypothetical families," indicating that it provided information on potential benefits available to families in Wisconsin.
The memo considered two hypothetical fam: one consisting of a single parent working part-time and earning $10,000 per year, and the other being a married couple with one full-time working parent and one part-time working parent, earning $50,000 per year.
